title.value: Laplacian Change Point Detection for Single and Multi-view Dynamic Graphs
title.justification: This is the exact title provided in the document.
title.quote: Laplacian Change Point Detection for Single and Multi-view Dynamic Graphs

extractions.description: The paper presents novel methods for change point detection in dynamic graphs using Laplacian spectra. The authors introduce Laplacian Anomaly Detection (LAD) for single-view graphs, which captures short-term and long-term dependencies. They also propose MultiLAD, an extension of LAD for multi-view dynamic graphs, which aggregates view-specific spectral summaries using the scalar power mean. The performance and robustness of these methods are validated through both synthetic and real-world experiments.

type.justification: The paper involves extensive performance evaluations and experiments on synthetic and real-world datasets to validate the proposed methods.
type.quote: Through evaluations on both synthetic and real world datasets, we showed that LAD is more effective at identifying significant events than previous state-of-the-art methods.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on detecting changes in the structure of dynamic graphs.
name.quote: In this paper, we focus on change point detection in dynamic graphs and address three main challenges associated with this problem.

name.justification: The methods introduced in the paper rely on spectral properties of graph Laplacians.
name.quote: Laplacian Anomaly Detection (LAD) which uses the spectrum of graph Laplacian as the low dimensional embedding of the graph structure.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with dynamic or temporal graphs, monitoring their evolution over time.
name.quote: Dynamic graphs are rich data structures that are used to model complex relationships between entities over time.

name.justification: The model is introduced as a novel change point detection method for single-view dynamic graphs.
